title: Greg Cooper
text:
Gregory John Luke Cooper (born 10 June 1965) is a former New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. A <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Full-back">fullback</a>, Cooper represented <a href="Hawke%27s%20Bay%20Rugby%20Union">Hawke's Bay</a>, <a href="Otago%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Otago</a> and <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Auckland</a> at a provincial level and the in <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a>. He was a member of the New Zealand national side, the <a href="All%20Blacks">All Blacks</a>, in 1986 and 1992, and played seven matches, all of them tests, for the team. he holds the record for the most points scored for Otago.
Cooper was appointed coach of the Otago team for the 2003 and 2004 seasons.
